description.narrative: In order to track progress on the adoption of ICTs and how these technologies are used by individuals and households in the country ZICTA aims to undertake a national survey access and usage of ICTs, together with the Central Statistical Office (CSO). The survey should provide data on connectivity and basic use of ICT services as well as an understanding of barriers to, and drivers for use, and of what people are doning and not doing online (social media use, digital finance/mobile money, e-government services, working etc).

description.narrative: The study: Household survey 2018 by ZICTA, with Central Statistical Office was carried out in 6150 households, around 30 000 persons, in all provinces. In addition to ICT issues covered in previous surveys in 2013 and 2015, this survey provided more insight in gender differences (all data sex-separated) ; in financial inclusion aspects (digital finance issues covered), and environmental aspects (especially e-waste). Also, all base data is publicly available (non-identifiable). Results Three of four have access to a mobile phone (more men than women).(2000: Peak of Zamtel, 90 000 fixed phone lines/10 million people, <1 %) Growing internet use (18 % - 31 % in urban-6 % in rural areas) mainly by smartphones, very few computers. (Facebook and Whatsapp are most used application) Radio use decreasing (from 45% in 2015 to 40 % 2018 of households own a radio). Almost half of the households have sent or recieved mobile money (obstacles: lack of money, literacy including financial and ICT, digital accounts, lack of float). There are continued large regional disparities reflecting inequalities in income and access to electricity. e-waste is a growing issue! Over one million mobile phones are discarded every year, no safe waste handling available. Budget and costs Thorough financial reporting presented, audited by external auditors. The auditors verifies that the funds used in accordance with the specific agreement, Zambia procurement act, ZICTA’s policies and procedures. The auditors further followed up on the recommendation from the assessment of intenal control during the due diligence phase. The recommendations have been addressed and in most cases resolved or are in process. Total cost of the survey was 3 059 114 ZMW, approximately 2 600 000 SEK, well within the budgetet 3 000 000 SEK.
